member.name: F:SuperMap.Chart.AttributeTypeChart.CodedString
member.summary: CodedString ('A'). It means the expected value is the ASCII string with the specified format.

member.name: F:SuperMap.Chart.AttributeTypeChart.FreeText
member.summary: FreeText ('S'). It means the expected value is the alphanumeric mixed string with free format.

member.name: T:SuperMap.Chart.ChartQuery
member.summary: Query the records of one or more chart DatasetGroup objects based on query parameters, and set the spatial extent to query. You can use the ChartQueryParameter class to set the parameters. The parameters includes FeatureInfo, AttributeFilter and the types of features to query.

member.name: M:SuperMap.Chart.ChartQuery.Query(SuperMap.Data.DatasetGroup[],SuperMap.Chart.ChartQueryParameter[],SuperMap.Data.CursorType)
member.summary: Finds feature objects conforming to the specified query parameters in one or more dataset group and returns the corresponding recordset.
member.param: The chart DatasetGroup array. It contains at least one DatasetGroup.
The given ChartQueryParameter array. It contains at least one ChartQueryParameter object.
The given CursorType. The recordset can be modified when the CursorType is Dynamic, and the recordset is readOnly when the CursorType is Static.
member.returns: ChartQueryResult array.
member.exception: The length of datasetGroups is 0, or the length of queryParameters is 0.

overloads.summary: Finds feature objects conforming to the specified query parameters in one or more chart dataset group and returns the correspoinding recordset.

member.name: M:SuperMap.Chart.ChartQuery.Query(SuperMap.Data.DatasetGroup[],SuperMap.Data.Rectangle2D,SuperMap.Chart.ChartQueryParameter[],SuperMap.Data.CursorType)
member.summary: Query the records in one or more chart DatasetGroup objects based on the given parameters in the given spatial extent.
member.param: The chart DatasetGroup array. It contains at least one DatasetGroup.
The specified space bounds.
The given ChartQueryParameter array. It contains at least one ChartQueryParameter object.
The given CursorType. The recordset can be modified when the CursorType is Dynamic, and the recordset is readOnly when the CursorType is Static.
member.returns: ChartQueryResult array.
member.exception: The length of datasetGroups is 0, or the length of queryParameters is 0.

The specified type of dataset.

member.name: M:SuperMap.Chart.S57DatasetGroupExtInfo.SetFeatureDataset(SuperMap.Data.Dataset)
member.summary:
Sets the feature dataset.
The dataset requires that the extension information of the dataset has been set. If the current dataset group already contains the dataset with the same type, then the set fails. Because the feature with the same type has multiple geometry types. Therefore, a kind of features in the chart dataset group contains the dataset with several types, and every type is unique.
member.returns: Returns true if successful,otherwise returns false.

member.name: T:SuperMap.Chart.S57EditDatasetGroup
member.summary: Class of dataset group for editable S-57 chart data. This class is used to edit and query the chart data. It can create, delete feature datasets, append records to the feature dataset, set basic information of nautical chart, set chain node topological relations for the chart, and check S-58 data.

member.name: M:SuperMap.Chart.S57EditDatasetGroup.CreateFeatureDataset(System.Int32,SuperMap.Data.DatasetType)
member.summary: Creates a new feature dataset according to the specified feature code and the dataset type, and adds this new feature dataset to the current editable S-57 chart dataset group. The creation will be failed if the corresponding feature dataset exists.
member.param: This specified feature code.
The specified dataset type. Point, line, region and tabular are supported.
member.returns: The new feature dataset. Return null if the creation is failed.

overloads.summary: Creates a new feature dataset according to the specified arguments, and adds this new feature dataset to the current editable S-57 chart dataset group.

member.name: M:SuperMap.Chart.S57EditDatasetGroup.CreateFeatureDataset(System.String,SuperMap.Data.DatasetType)
member.summary: Creates a new feature dataset according to the specified feature acronym and the dataset type, and adds this new feature dataset to the current editable S-57 chart dataset group. The creation will be failed if the corresponding feature dataset exists.
member.param: The specified feature acronym.
The specified dataset type. Point, line, region and tabular are supported.
member.returns: The new feature dataset. Return null if the creation is failed.

member.name: M:SuperMap.Chart.S57EditDatasetGroup.AppendFeatureDataset(System.Int32,SuperMap.Data.Recordset,System.String[],System.String[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Appends recordset to the feature dataset with the given feature code and the dataset type from the current editable S-57 chart dataset group.
member.param: This specified feature code.
The specified feature dataset to be appended.
The source field array, corresponding to the field in the source recordset to be appended.
The specified target field array, corresponding to the fields in the new or existed feature dataset.

Whether to create a new feature dataset or not when the feature dataset doesn't exist. The new dataset will be created and the recordset appended if it is true; otherwise, false. Note, the recordset will be always appended to the dataset if the feature dataset exists, regardless of true or false.
member.returns: The feature dataset after being appended successfully.

overloads.summary: Appends the recordset to the feature dataset of the current editable S-57 chart dataset group according to the given aurgments.

member.param: The specified feature acronym.
The specified feature dataset to be appended.
The source field array, corresponding to the field in the source recordset to be appended.
The specified target field array, corresponding to the fields in the new or existed feature dataset.

Whether to create a new feature dataset or not when the feature dataset doesn't exist. The new dataset will be created and the recordset appended if it is true; otherwise, false. Note, the recordset will be always appended to the dataset if the feature dataset exists, regardless of true or false.
member.returns: The feature dataset after being appended successfully.

member.name: T:SuperMap.Chart.S57LexicalLevel
member.summary: This enumeration defines S-57 character set constant.

member.name: F:SuperMap.Chart.S57LexicalLevel.Level0
member.summary: Level 0, i.e., ASC â…¡ text, ISO / IEC 646 international reference version (IRV).

member.name: F:SuperMap.Chart.S57LexicalLevel.Level1
member.summary: Level 1, i.e., the first part of the ISO 8859, the Latin alphabet series 1 (such as Western Europe, Latin). Level 1 character set can be directly used in almost all computer systems.

member.name: F:SuperMap.Chart.S57LexicalLevel.Level2
member.summary: Level 2, i.e., the UCS-2 complement level 1 (non-combining characters), ISO/IEC 10646 multilingual platform (for example, including Latin characters, Greek, Cyrillic, Chinese, Japanese, etc.). Level 2 character set is suitable for almost all languagesâ€‹â€‹, but its coding efficiency is low.
